pages.text: Used most commonly for creating advanced brews that mundane Brewing Stands simply can’t match. Certain other items can be boiled down and combined in the cauldron to create new ones. Cauldrons require magic energy and need a fire under them to work. At any point, Wood Ash can be thrown in to clear the cauldron.
When filled with this magical mixture, the Goblet will give more power to altars, as well as emit a redstone signal.
An alchemically created plant. It emits burning cinders that ignite those who touch it. This plant will also spread, making it great for base defence.
An alchemically created plant. It emits light from the bulb at the end of its woody stem. Just as natural plants do, the Torchwood spreads.
Boiled fat of the dead. Used for candles and more.
Sticky.
A cruelty-free substitute for Ink Sacs. Some claim it is vital in the creation of demonic contracts…
A wood-derived alternative to cocoa beans for brown dye.
A more mundane use of the cauldron is to clean dye from banners.
While looking like any other innocent flower, the alchemical-created Siphoning Flower is covered with tiny barbs and spines, and will take a sample of blood from those who touch it.
This sample can be harvested by using a boline on the flower while an Empty Taglock is held in the offhand. This recipe is applicable to all vanilla flowers.
An alchemically created mushroom. This mushroom produces a rich blue pigment in its gelatinous gleba, allowing it to be used as a substitute for blue dye.
While seeming as a living contradiction, this alchemically created flower’s fluids freeze on contact with the air, and can be crafted into a snowball.

pages.title: Teleporting
pages.text: A cauldron with Dimensional Sand thrown into it allows a user standing inside to teleport to other cauldrons that have been named via Name Tag by saying its name in chat.

pages.title: Disposal
pages.text: A cauldron that contains Lava will destroy any item thrown into it, as well as set any living entities on fire if they stand in it.

pages.title: Brews
pages.text: In order to designate cauldron tomfoolery as a brew, a Mandrake Root must be thrown in first before any other reagents. After that, throw in the other reagents you wish, however the more you add, the more expensive the brew will be, ME-wise.

Including redstone will increase the duration of the brew, up to a certain amount. Glowstone has the same effect on potency, and a Raven's Feather will prevent particles from appearing. Gunpowder may also be thrown in to create a splash brew, and if an Owlet's Wing is thrown in as well, it becomes a lingering brew.
Heals the target if they are alive, or damages them if undead
Damages the target if they are alive, or heals them if undead
Grants regeneration if the target is alive, does nothing otherwise
Poisons the target if they are alive, does nothing otherwise
Similar to poison but the capacity to kill, and damages undead as well
Allows the target to see clearly in low light areas. The Eye of Old will give this in addition to Water Breathing
Obscures the target's vision, and prevents them from sprinting
Strengthens the target's arms, allowing them to deal more melee damage
Weakens the target's arms, forcing them to deal less melee damage
Toughens the target's skin to receive less damage from non magical sources
Grants the target immunity to fire and lava
Gives a temporarily boost to health
Strengthens the target's legs, allowing them to jump higher
Strengthens the target's legs, allowing them to move faster
Weakens the target's legs, forcing them to move slower
Strengthens the target's arms, allowing them to mine and attack faster
Weakens the target's arms, forcing them to mine and attack slower
Gives the target a better chance at obtaining good loot
Gives the target a worse chance at obtaining good loot
Causes the target the grow a temporary set of gills, allowing them to breath while submerged in liquid. The Eye of Old will give this in addition to Night Vision
Causes all light to pass through the target, rendering them invisible. Does not apply to the target's armor and held items, however
Causes the target to think too much about their next meal
Disorients the target
Causes the target to glow
Slowly raises the target into the air
Purges the target of all potion effects
Purges the target of negative potion effects
Purges the target of positive potion effects
Allows the target to take less damage from magical sources
Makes the target take more damage from magical sources
Converts the surrounding area into a Nether-like landscape, and sets some of the land and all entities unfortunate enough to be hit by the splash on fire

Converts the surrounding area into a winter wonderland, and extinguishes fires both on the ground and on entities. Perpetual Ice, a form of ice that does not melt, may appear, and may be crafted into Embittered Bricks similar to Stone Bricks
Converts sand and colored blocks to their red counterpart
Converts red sand and colored blocks to their yellow counterpart
Converts various and plants into their desert counterpart
Causes plants to grow and animals to breed
Instantly harvests and re-plants seeds, and may make leaves drop apples and cause pumpkins to grow
Causes mushrooms, mycelium, ferns, and moss to grow. I hope you don’t have allergies…
Kills plants and crops, and weakens living creatures
Causes various blocks to decay or break down
Damages arthropods
Wraps the target in spider webs, and summons hungry spiders to attack them
Turn dirt and mycelium to grass, and cure zombie villagers
Next only to the Holy Hand Grenade! Damages unholy creatures, such as undead or demons
Damages wolves and other canids
Damages outcasts of society, such as illagers or witches. Has no effect on witch hunters
Blinds and slows the target, and may kill them if they are on low enough health
KABOOM. Explode upon taking damage. Does not affect blocks
Causes the target to take less fall damage
Damages those who attack the target
Ting! Reflects arrows and other projectiles away from the target
Purges invisibility from hit entities
Takes off the armour and baubles of a target
It becomes harder to jump, to the point of preventing jumping at stronger potencies
Throws the target into the air, making them unable to act and then taking fall damage
